availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert S. Russell (Muhlenburg co tavern keep)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer and tavern keeper. Kentucky native. Married Celia M. Russell. Father of Lucy R. Russell, Rebecca Russell, Samuel Russell, and Edward Russell. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1840. Owned ten enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1840. Tavern keeper in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Tavern keeper in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, p. 336.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 222B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District No. 1, p. 599.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
Find A Grave, "Robert S Russell (1810-1873)," Memorial 71473594, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/71473594 (accessed November 7, 2019).
